column1: Prisca was the second child and daughter of [[Polo Baggins]].<ref>{{App
column2: Baggins}}</ref> She married [[Wilibald Bolger]], and had three children: [[Wilimar Bolger
column5: Nora]]. Her husband passed away before {{SR
column6: 1401}}, but she attended [[Bilbo's Farewell Party]] with her children.<ref>{{App
column8: 50}}</ref><ref group=note>[[The Lord of the Rings (50th Anniversary Edition)
column9: The 50th Anniversary edition of ''The Lord of the Rings'']] includes Prisca as a guest at the Farewell Party. In older editions of Appendix C, Prisca did not appear as an attendee. Robert Foster in his ''[[The Complete Guide to Middle-earth]]'' thus states that Prisca died ''before'' {{TA

column1: ''Prisca'' is a Latin/Italian word meaning "former, old" from which derives the name [[Priscilla Tolkien
